Other Information.Additional Info: The channels in MOF-801 are smaller than the size of sodium ions, thus rejecting them.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Heavy metal solution (2000 ppm), FO mode
Other Information.Additional Info: Rejection rate >94%, influenced by both size exclusion and adsorption properties.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Heavy metal solution (2000 ppm), FO mode
Other Information.Additional Info: Rejection rate >94%, influenced by both size exclusion and adsorption properties.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Heavy metal solution (2000 ppm), FO mode
Other Information.Additional Info: Rejection rate >94%, influenced by both size exclusion and adsorption properties.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with adsorption

Experimental Validation.Method: Forward osmosis experiments and QCM-D adsorption studies
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Water flux increase: 30% compared to TFC membrane; Reverse salt flux decrease: 44%; Heavy metal rejection: >94% for Ni2+, Cd2+, Pb2+.

Other Information.Additional Info: MOF-801 nanocrystals were uniformly dispersed in the PA layer via PDA adhesion, improving water permeability and salt rejection performance.
